lines.text: I don't understand a word you're saying, but I love the sound of your voice.
I'm afraid it's pneumonia. Think you oughtta get him to a hospital.
Well, why didn't you send him to a hospital?
We didn't have any authorization.
You got it now.
[takes pen and paper out; writes; hands paper to attendant]
Get an ambulance; I'm taking him out of here. And call these numbers - tell 'em to get down here right away.

[looking at paper]
Mrs Martin - is that his wife?
Yes.
And the other one?
She's *not* his wife.
You can call me Amy.
I bet I could.
Can I lend you some money?
Wouldn't know what to do with it.
I'm not going to be tied down to anybody or anything. From now on, I'm playing it my way.

[to Amy]
That trumpet's part of me. It's the best part. You almost made me forget that.

[to Amy]
What a dope I was. I thought you were class, like a real high note you only hit once in a lifetime.

[to Amy]
You're like those carnival joints I used to work in. Big flash on the outside, but on the inside nothing but filth.
Call me sometime.
Call ya what?
